Clinical: Eye, inflammation of. Headache. Rheumatism. Vertigo.
Characteristics: Convol. d. was proved under Mure, and some symptoms that are peculiar have been recorded: Reveries in daytime. Numbness in limbs. Dreams of dead persons. Symptoms are < in morning and > after cold bath.
Head: Vertigo with faintness.
Burning in frontal region, ceasing after a cold bath.
Pain in frontal region with heat at root of nose.
Pain in l. temple (corresponding to inflamed l. eye).
Throat: Heat and dryness at anterior and upper part of oesophagus.
Abdomen: Pain in abdomen with internal heat.
Upper Limbs: Numbness of arms, <, when hanging down.
Pains in l. shoulder; in l. wrist.
Numbness of r. index and middle fingers.
Lower Limbs: Pain fore part of l. leg for four days.
Sleep: Dreams: about quarrelling; about dead persons; falling out of his front teeth; of flying along a lighted street; appearance of a ghost; wakes with a start.
